content.title: Atherosclerosis: Foundation of Vascular Disease
content.summary: Atherosclerosis is a chronic inflammatory disease of arteries characterized by lipid accumulation and plaque formation, representing the most common cause of arterial occlusive disease.

stages.description: Initial injury from risk factors causes endothelial activation
LDL accumulation and oxidation in intima
Organized lipid core with smooth muscle migration

content.clinical_significance: Atherosclerosis underlies the majority of conditions treated by vascular surgeons, including peripheral arterial disease, carotid stenosis, and aneurysmal disease
